title.narrative: DAC Guidance on donor support, engaging with CS 2017-19 & amendment to 2022
DAC Guidance on donor support, engaging with CS 2017-19 & amendment to 2022

description.narrative: Insatsen utgör ett stöd till resultatområde 15 i OECD/DAC Programme of Work and Budget (PWB) 2017-2018. Resultatområdet är inriktat på att OECD/DAC bättre ska ta tillvara den kunskap och kapacitet som NGOs och det övriga civila samhället spelar inom utvecklingssamarbetet.

Sida supports output 15 of OECD/DAC Programme of Work and Budget (PWB) 2017-2018. The aim is for OECD/DAC to improve its ability to take advantage of the knowledge and the capacity that rests with NGOs and the civil society at large in the field of development cooperation.

"Increased legitimacy and impact of OECD norms and standards on sustainable development through more strategic engagement with civil society.
Development agencies of provider countries, in collaboration with civil society organisations, provide more effective support to civil society organisations to achieve key SDGs focused on the most vulnerable poor people in developing countries."

Decision on Amendment of contribution, DAC Guidance on donor support, engaging with CS 2017-2019 and amendment to 2022
Decision on contribution, DAC Guidance donor support, engaging with Civil Society

description.narrative: The dialogue between the DAC and CSOs has been reinforced with the adoption (in July 2018) and implementation of the DAC-CSO dialogue framework. Following the adoption of the Dialogue Framework, consultations that were once ad hoc and informal are now institutionalised. CSOs now have a space to engage with and influence the DAC; the DAC is also able to leverage civil society knowledge and capabilities in development co-operation through the diverse range of CSO constituencies represented in the DAC-CSO Reference Group (RG). The dialogue represents a significant step forward, which is important both for the accountability structure and the quality of the policy-making process of the DAC.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
